website_summaries.verdict: Excellent impact driver that offers the versatility to help you accomplish most tasks successfully.
pros: Gives you four different operational speed settings, which makes this model great for a variety of jobs
Includes an "assist" mode, which automatically changes the speed at which it's driving the screw to avoid damage to the screw or to the wood
Should give you a nice level of longevity
cons: May deliver more power and features than some people need for simple jobs

customer_reviews.title: The XDT 12Z is now made in CHINA! BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: October 18, 2019:. I bought the XDT 12Z instead of the newer XDT 16Z totally because the XDT 12Z was made in Japan. No longer. It's now made in China. Makita obviously is moving away from building is top of the line models in Japan and it's lower line models in China in favor of building everything in China. That's a shame. Packing up the 12Z and returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Luigi

customer_reviews.title: ... metal stud framing and it is a work horse love the 4
customer_reviews.text: I use this every day doing metal stud framing and it is a work horse love the 4 speed
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: i like that it has some added benefits of adjusting speeds
customer_reviews.text: im mostly a diy'er fixer upper and splurged on this impct driver. so far am lovvving it! i like that it has some added benefits of adjusting speeds, and how smaller and lighter it is to the 13z that came with my drill. ive been using this for most of my diy fixup tasks, including some fence and gate repair. have tested it on lugnuts on my car (torqued at 80ftlbs) and it took em off with ease. its pretty easy to use that im choosing this over my drill on most occasions
customer_reviews.author: albert truong

customer_reviews.title: Best impact driver on the market, hands down. Tad expensive though.
customer_reviews.text: Simply awesome impact driver. I’d say best their is. Better than Dewalt, Milwaukee, etc. unbelievably light, with awesome ergonomic feel in your hand. 5ah batt packs are the Bomb. Tad expensive though.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin R

customer_reviews.title: I especially like the slow-down just before seating the fastener
customer_reviews.text: Very adjustable for different fastener situations. I especially like the slow-down just before seating the fastener, which leaves room for the torque wrench finish. High quality Makita fit and finish, smooth and quiet operation, light weight and good looks. It has made work easier and faster for me.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Wifey enjoying her new tool...
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews and looking at different products I chose the Makita XDT12T impact driver. My wife and I installed the top deck of Azek with this tool and it was amazing. Lightweight and powerful with plenty of battery life, it sang through this project. I ended getting a saw as well when I realized how powerful the batteries were. I now have a light and will continue adding to the Makita power family.
customer_reviews.author: Jdob2000

customer_reviews.title: This is such a powerful and comfortable tool
customer_reviews.text: I had to spend a couple days driving concrete anchors and this guy killed it. Not only did this tool seem quiet compared to other drivers, the multiple settings are amazing, and given the chance it seemed it could drive a bolt unil it was through the material. The driver itself is very lightweight but still felt balanced with the 5.0 amp battery. I've used the red and yellow (a huge fan of both of them) impact drivers, but for me this one is the one to go with.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M Lee

customer_reviews.title: The torque and speed of this is amazing. I've been using impact drivers for 20 years ...
customer_reviews.text: SO much power. The head on this driver is very small so you can get into some really tight spots. The torque and speed of this is amazing. I've been using impact drivers for 20 years from all the big brands and this is the best by far.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S.

customer_reviews.title: It's compact.
customer_reviews.text: Looks like it will fit in some tighter spots than my wxt02z or the makita quiet oil based impact I have. More adjustments of speed and tourque should be helpful when not torquing stuff to "factory spec".
customer_reviews.author: Soaring

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: Item no longer made in Japan. Made in China now. I rather buy the Japanese version elsewhere for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetmullet

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but go get the XDT16 instead
customer_reviews.text: This is a great driver, tough, worth the money, BUT, I also own the brand new XDT16 and it's a lot better than this one. Just buy that one, you can thank me later. See my review there for more info.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Donton

customer_reviews.title: Makita XDT12Z MADE IN JAPAN
customer_reviews.text: Makita XDT12. MADE IN JAPAN. I'm not sure why some people are saying this model is made in China. This impact driver is the best 18 volt you can get. Very light and extremely powerful. A very rugged build. I'm glad Amazon still has it available. They are getting increasingly harder to find.
customer_reviews.author: Van Butler

customer_reviews.title: Commercial grade
customer_reviews.text: The Z in the item number indicates that it is for heavy duty commercial use. This one will last a lot longer than the ones we had been purchasing from home Depot.

customer_reviews.title: Makita speaks for itself.
customer_reviews.text: The Makita name has come to mean high quality to me. When I need a tool to be dependable and long lasting I always see if Makita makes it.

customer_reviews.text: Awesome impact driver!! Love Makita tools! I have to, as I have the batteries for them. This is very powerful and the new settings make the tool really easy to control during different applications. I would highly reccomend this product and this supplier, it arrived quickly and in good order.

customer_reviews.text: Bought this after my other impact called it quits after alot of use day in and day out, very satisfied after a 56 hour work week of heavy use as usual, light, well balanced and power to spare, many different settings for many different applications. Love this little thing!

customer_reviews.title: Get the brushless!
customer_reviews.text: Far more control with the brushless. There is a big difference between the driver's with and without brushes. Get the brushless you won't be disappointed!

customer_reviews.text: The best impact money can buy. I have two. Just dont use the chuck as a quick hammer because it will begin to screech over time. Still the best you can buy.

customer_reviews.title: Best makita impact driver EVER
customer_reviews.text: Best makita impact driver EVER! Light, and great trigger feel for variable speed. Loads of power and highly adjustable torque settings

customer_reviews.text: Bad ass. Better then my old brushless impact. Speed is jus as fast as the 20v dewalts. IMO "was" the fastest impact

customer_reviews.title: A great tool and a good price
customer_reviews.text: A very good impact driver. I tried the XDT09, and was very impressed, then saw that a newer model was released. It has much more adjustability, speed, and power than several other impact drivers tried. The trigger offers great control too, which is very valuable when it comes to driving screws.

customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this tool. It is the best impact on the market.

customer_reviews.title: Another great Makita tool
customer_reviews.text: Excellent addition to my toolbox. Great for installing/removing deck screws, small lags, siding screws, and any fastener that needs some power to install correctly. Small size, but plenty of power, and multiple speeds.

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: Excellent impact drill. Exceeded my expectations. Self-tapper setting is especially mind blowing. Could not be happier.

customer_reviews.title: Great drill
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my father for Christmas and he's always about getting top of the line products. After much research, I decided on the XDT12Z and must say I'm happy with the purchase. My father loved the drill, it's quiet, compact and powerful.

customer_reviews.title: I love it. It work great a little pricey but ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It work great a little pricey but i would buy it again. I like the speed changes and the extra speed it has.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Winkelman

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best impact driver
customer_reviews.text: Extremely powerful and fast impact driver. Love the fact that it has 4 speeds and has a the option to turn the light off. The assist mode works very well. It is compact and relatively light. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kaden D.

customer_reviews.title: I'm pretty excited to receive my combo kit Wednesday
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty excited to receive my combo kit Wednesday, pretty upset though because it was suppose to be delivered Friday. Was then told Monday, so I pushed the job I was suppose to start today to Tuesday, now I find out its coming Wednesday. I've always liked Makita but, Hilti will never slow you down when it comes to getting a job done. Question; I was going to order a third battery, but I didn't know if there was space for a third battery in the case, though. The 2 drill combo kits hold five, not sure if the one spots for a battery but a 3.0Ah fits just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They all work perfectly fine, and lasted many years except this impact
customer_reviews.text: I own 13 different makita cordless tools. They all work perfectly fine, and lasted many years except this impact. 2 months it broke and no replacement thru where I purchased it. By your tools grim cpo
customer_reviews.author: ICE BOX

product_meta.title: Makita XDT12Z 18V LXT Lithium-Ion Brushless Cordless Quick-Shift Mode 4-Speed Impact Driver, Tool Only,
product_meta.description: Makita has a legacy of innovation in the cordless impact driver Category, and the XDT12Z sets new standards. The XDT12Z has more torque and more speed than previous models, yet it has more features and the most compact size in the 18 volt Category. For contractors, the XDT12Z is a total fastening solution (18V LXT batteries and charger sold separately). the XDT12Z offers users four speed settings, as well as Makita’s exclusive Quick-Shift mode for increased fastening control. Precision fastening applications often require the user to stop or slow down the impact driver just prior to driving the screw into place to ensure there is no damage to the fastener or work piece. Quick-shift mode is an automatic electronic controller that downshifts to reduce rotation and impact speed prior to driving the screw into place. It is engineered to minimize screw thread stripping, screw breakage and damage to work. In addition, the XDT12Z features assist mode, which helps eliminate "screw cam-out" and "cross threading" by driving at low speed until tightening begins. It is ideal for driving longer fasteners. The Makita-built BL Brushless motor delivers a full 1,550 in.Lbs. Of max torque in the 4th speed setting. The 4-speed power selection switch provides the user with precise fastening control for a range of applications, from cabinet screws to lag bolts. It weighs only 3.3 lbs. With the 4.0Ah battery, and with a length of only 4-5/8" it is the most compact in its Category.
feature_bullets: Quick-Shift mode selector has an automatic electronic controller that downshifts and reduces rotation and impact speed prior to driving screw into place
BL Brushless motor delivers 3,600 max RPM and 1,550 in.Lbs. Of max torque
4-Speed power selection switch (0-1,100/ 0-2,100/ 0-3,200/ 0-3,600 RPM & 0-1,100/ 0-2,600/ 0-3,600/ 0-3,800 IPM) provides precise fastening control for a wide range of applications
Assist mode (a-mode) feature helps eliminate "screw cam-out" and "cross threading" by driving at low speed until tightening begins
Tightening mode (t-mode) for faster tightening of Self-Drilling screws; helps prevent damage to the screw or workpiece

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars107 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
